comment.text: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein.
Expressed in brain, lung, kidney, prostate, ovary, placenta, pancreas and testis.
Chromosomal aberrations involving CDKL5 are found in patients manifesting early-onset seizures and spams and psychomotor impairment. Translocation t(X;6)(p22.3;q14); translocation t(X;7)(p22.3;p15).

disease.name: Epileptic encephalopathy, early infantile, 2
disease.description: A severe form of epilepsy characterized by seizures or spasms beginning in infancy. Patients with epileptic encephalopathy early infantile type 2 manifest features resembling Rett syndrome such as microcephaly, lack of speech development, stereotypic hand movements. However, EIEE2 and Rett syndrome are considered two distinct entities.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. CMGC Ser/Thr protein kinase family. CDC2/CDKX subfamily.
It is uncertain whether Met-1 or Met-10 is the initiator.

property.value: P:positive regulation of dendritic spine development

feature.description: In EIEE2; causes mislocalization of the protein in the cytoplasm; dbSNP:rs122460159.
